result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher X Beverly was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees. Court found the domestic abuse surcharge is not applicable. The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercpet or other means.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with firearms.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.

No further violations of the law.
No controlled substances; random screens.
No contact with victim unless approved by agent. 3rd party contact for the purpose of child visitation.

Complete batterer's intervention program.
Attend parenting classes.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence. 
Provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge during Extended Supervision, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.

charges.descr: Endangering safety by Use of a Dangerous Weapon (Discharge Firearm w/in 100 Yards/Bldg)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher X Beverly

records.addlTxt: 10/30/20 Applied bond to the following Case #:  14CF521 for $175.78 from No prosecution dated 10/24/20.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (8 pages) commencing 07/29/2014 SENTENCING HEARING received and filed.

Defendant Christopher X Beverly in court with attorney Bridget J. Krause.  Defendant Christopher X Beverly in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Statements made as to sentencing.  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 54 MONTHS, with credit for 174 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 36 MONTHS.  
.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program; is not eligible or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- No further violations of the law.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Attend parenting classes.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- No controlled substances; random screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by agent.
- 3rd party contact for the purpose of child visitation.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees.  Court found the domestic abuse surcharge is not applicable.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
.
Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.
.
Defendant ordered to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge during Extended Supervision, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Christopher X Beverly in court with attorney Bridget J Krause.  Defendant Christopher X Beverly in custody.  Michael C Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.
*
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Sentencing scheduled for 7/29/14 at 8:30 am.

Defendant Christopher X Beverly in court with attorney Bridget J Krause.  Defendant Christopher X Beverly in custody.  Michael C Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 7/07/14 in Branch 40.  Court will decide state's motion on day of trial.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.
for Joinder of Cases received and filed.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.  rmm

Defendant Christopher X Beverly in court with attorney Bridget J Krause.  Defendant Christopher X Beverly in custody.  Ryan T Sanson for Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 7/07/14 in Branch 40.  State to file brief on motion for joinder with the court by 6/20/14; defense to file response by 6/27/14.  Parties would like another final pretrial date.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher X Beverly in court with attorney Bridget J Krause.  Defendant Christopher X Beverly in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for final pretrial Conference.  Due to the new case, Court granted defense motion to adjourn the jury trial.  Court held state's motion for joinder in abeyance.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Bridget J. Krause in court, defendant Christopher X Beverly not in court, in custody.  Molly Marie Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for final pretrial conference.  State is going to be issuing new charges against the defendant.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Bridget Krause in court, defendant Christopher X Beverly not in court, in custody.  Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Scheduling Conference held off the record.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty as to count 1.  Case adjourned to Br. 40  on 2-26-2014 at 8:30am for Scheduling.

Defendant Christopher X Beverly in court with attorney Bridget Krause.  Defendant Christopher X Beverly in custody.  Ryan T. Sanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HEARD FOR BRANCH 40.
Court takes judicial notice of the judgment of conviction as to case 12 CF263 attached to criminal complaint.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: PO Daniel Priewe(MPD)
State rests.  Defense rests.
Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ARRIEL R. OR KEYENTAY H.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Christopher X Beverly in court with attorney Reyna I Morales.  Defendant Christopher X Beverly in custody.  Sara B Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant pled not guilty TO MISDEMEANOR COUNT 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DALLET, Branch 40.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 40.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
